Reviews.Title: Love this laptop!
Reviews.Author: HollyW0607
Reviews.Content: When I retired from my full time job, I wanted to get an up to date laptop for home for my part time job of teaching at our community college. My desktop is 8 years old and slow! I researched for several months, checked the local stores, and wound up ordering this Toshiba through Amazon Sellers. I'm using it right now to type this review. It's a great laptop for the price. It doesn't have a touch screen but I didn't want that. It does have the RAM that I wanted, the mid-range Intel processor, and the hard drive that I wanted. I love that it has a numeric keyboard - my laptop at my full time job didn't have that - and it still has the DVD-R so I can watch movies, etc. It's got a big enough screen and is very light weight, something I really needed since it will be traveling with me quite a bit as I visit my new grandsons this fall, both of whom will be over 1000 miles away. It has a cool design to it, very sleek and modern looking, not that I cared about that but it's a nice bonus. Two things that aren't great - I'm still getting used to the keyboard. The keys seem to require that you hit them dead on. Haven't found a way to adjust the touch, if there is a way (and I admit, I only read the quick start up instructions). The other thing is; I HATE WINDOWS 8!!! Nothing to do with the laptop but it came with 8.1 and I did that intentionally since the college where I teach is going to that in all the in-class computers. The good news is that I have managed to get the laptop to mostly boot up in more of a Win7 look but I still have trouble finding things on the laptop that were so easy with XP and not much worse with Win7 (I didn't like Vista, either, but even that was better than Win8). Bottom line, this is a great laptop for someone who does a lot of classroom type stuff, videos, etc. Boots up fast and has lots of speed for videos and Web searches. Plenty of USB ports, too. I don't know how it would be for gaming since I don't play anything other than Solitaire on the computer (I much prefer XBox or Wii for gaming). It's lightweight and loaded with features at a reasonable price. It came in just a few days, well packed for shipping, and took me no time at all to set up. Would probably be great for business people, definitely great for educators.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled!
Reviews.Author: Karen HElms
Reviews.Content: It was purchased for a friend snd he loves it! Fast and also streamline for people on the go. Great product at a great price!

Reviews.Title: is not 4th generation  its 3th GENERATION
Reviews.Author: Ricardo M.
Reviews.Content: THE specifications indicates that it is the 4th generation core i5 .. but it is not so ...IS  3rd generation

Reviews.Title: I love my new laptop
Reviews.Author: Josefina Silva
Reviews.Content: Is a excellent machine. recommend for photoshop, lightroom,photo. Is very quickly. have a good hard disk with internet is very good

Reviews.Title: Trackpad and keyboard not up to the mark
Reviews.Author: Ronnie
Reviews.Content: After using a macbook pro, the trackpad and keyboard does not match expectation. The trackpad seems to be too sensitive and scrolling through a page leads to accidentally clicking some link and also selecting text on the page. The keys on the key board need to be pressed properly from the center else the key press does not take effect. Performance-wise seems to be ok so far.
